author: Juene Wijaya
comment: Great app! Finally a really nice simple breathing exercise app for android wear! Love the graphic style! Would love to see more features such as adjusting the inhale exhale timing, custom colour plus more shape variations. Keep up the good work!

author: Russell Lindsey
comment: Not sure how to contact the company, saw they want feedback so I'll put that here. I am given a cue for breathing in but no cue is given for when I am to exhale. I'm left just holding my breath.

reply.author: w9 software
reply.content: Thank you for your feedback. Cue for breathing in only is by design. You should relax and just naturally breath out after breath in. After few breaths, your breathing rhythm should stabilize and become completely natural. Nevertheless, we will consider adding optional breath out cues in a future update.

author: Michael Brown
comment: Awesome app! It does exactly as it should and I'm glad it's a Android Wear first application. I love the tiny vibrations that it does on the watch. For future versions. It would be nice to have a Google Fit add-on.

author: Indrani Dawn
comment: I would like to be able to customize inhale hold exhale durations, and also reminders to do the exercises would be helpful maybe enable a trigger from the mutlitimer

author: Raj
comment: The vibrations are a bit weird but the graphics are nice. Perfect alternative to the Breathe app on Apple Watches.

author: Eric Bailey
comment: Please support heart rate BPM. I need to know how many beats my heart produced after the minute of breathing. Please.

author: Rohith Miah
comment: Just like apples breathe app for apple watch
Great, simple app, but it has too little features. Wear support is a huge plus but I'd like for it to do more than just vibrate and show a picture. Eg. alarms, track heart rate, etc.

author: Supernatural Ninth
comment: I enjoyed the pleasant User Interface but I didn't realize until after downloading the app that its Android Wear. Not sure how to use it without A.W. technology.
